content: How can I create a string in Python that contains both single and double quotations (' and "), without Python automatically correcting this to ('\'', '\"')?

To create a string in Python that contains both single and double quotation marks without Python automatically escaping them, you can use triple quotes. Triple quotes allow you to include both types of quotation marks without needing to escape them. You can use either triple single quotes (`'''`) or triple double quotes (`"""`). Here's how you can do it:

Using triple single quotes:

```python
my_string = '''This is a string with both single (') and double (") quotes.'''
print(my_string)
```

Using triple double quotes:

```python
my_string = """This is a string with both single (') and double (") quotes."""
print(my_string)
```

Both of these methods will allow you to include both single and double quotes in your string without needing to escape them.
